result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon E Simmons

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Shannon E Simmons.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for review hearing. Defense has not received an updated doctor's report and requested adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 36. Review hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Outpatient Competency Restoration Program- Admission Decision
Proposed Order: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a competency hearing.  Doctor Deborah Collins sworn and testified in court.  Court adopts the Doctor's findings and orders the defendant to the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program (OCRP).  Court scheduled review hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Doctor's Report Return  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed Dr. Collins' report and defense request a hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Collins on June 8, 2022  at 10:00 am.   Court ordered case is adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report, Branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF108 (Jefferson County). Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer D. Schneider. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Shannon E Simmons in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 1p
Actual Date Bond Posted with Milwaukee County Sheriff on 02/26/22
Defendant out on bail as of 02/26/2022.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
